item.description:
An event for Minilympic teams only. Please do not RSVP unless you are registered in the Minilympics roster.

This event will be an elimination style tournament. Each round, player(s) with the lowest score will be eliminated until we have a winner or winners.

This event is worth 30 points for 1st place and 15 points for 2nd place. All teams will receive 5 points for participating.
.

 

The Game: Word Squares is another game whose introduction to this group could solely be coming from the Minilympics.  It's a shame too because it is essentially free to play and could be thought of as a cross between Scrabble and Boggle (both popular games in this group and neither of which made the cut).  This game focuses on strategic and long term planning as much as it requires a clever vocabulary and could challenge people's linguistic abilities in a way not done before.

Tournament will run from 6pm to 10pm for 10 players.  If you wish to participate as a spectator, please say so in the comments and we will have room on a first come, first serve basis for 6 people.

 

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
Did you know? (A Tribute to Gaming around the World):

Just to mess with your head, Chinese Checkers is neither a variation of checkers, nor is it related to anything Chinese.  It was invented and patented in Germany by Ravensburger, a famous game company that is still producing games today.
